docblock.description: Provides a means of redirecting a page conditionally based on whether the destination is where the user currently is or not.
Manages conditionally redirecting pages based on the requested uri and a given uri to redirect from.
docblock.long-description:
Checks to see if the uri requested by the user contains the uri to redirect from, and prepares to perform the redirect if so.
Relies on the redirect class to manage the actual redirecting, this class is primarly an interface to it that deals with the conditional aspect.

tag.name: var
tag.description: • whether or not the redirect needs to occur

docblock.description: Creates an instance of the conditional redirect class and decides whether the redirect will be performed
Applies the redirect to the page if the redirect should happen
Contains functions for testing the functionality of the inventory class
Contains classes to manage generating page redirects.
docblock.long-description: This is a meta-file, which simply includes a group of classes so that imports in other files can be cleaner.

docblock.description: Contains functions for basic web capabilities such as reading variables from the URL (safely), setting/getting cookies and config options.

tag.name: copyright
tag.description: Nate Levesque 2013 Language: PHP Filename: core_web.php

docblock.description: Checks to see if the preferred file exists, and if it does returns it, otherwise it returns the secondary file, which ideally should be a file (like an error page) that is guaranteed to exist.

tag.name: param
tag.description: (string): the secondary, emergency page to include

docblock.description: Displays a string with a random greeting and the string the function was called with.

tag.name: return
tag.description: a string with a personal greeting

docblock.description: Built to abstract retrieving config variables, since they're now contained in a class this is just for legacy support until everything else gets moved off of using this function

tag.name: param
tag.description: • the name of a config key to retrieve

tag.name: return
tag.description: the value of the config key

docblock.description: Provides resources for sanitizing user input, including removing garbage characters, truncating strings to fit in their location, and providing various outputs in an html safe form if requested.
Manages sanitizing user input. Currently works only for strings, but adding functions to sanitize other data types is trivial.
docblock.long-description: Retrieving sanitized values from the class involves invoking the __get function with the type, str, arr, bool, etc for whichever sanitation functions are implemented. The sanitization for the requested return is called (returns an empty object if the sanitization can't convert the current one to the requested one).

tag.name: var
tag.description: (int) - the maximum allowed length of the string

tag.name: var
tag.description: (int) - the maximum allowed length of the string

docblock.description: Constructs an instance of the class containing the original variable and the sanitized variable

tag.name: param
tag.description: (int) - a maximum length for the variable

docblock.description: Returns a sanitized version of the variable. If the requested type is not the same as the actual type, the class will attempt to convert it to the type if possible. Note that list cannot become a string.

tag.name: param
tag.description: • the type of data to return (str, bool, arr, etc)

docblock.description: Verify that a string is made of html-safe characters and short enough to fit where it belongs. Basically some simple input sanitizing for nonsecure things.
Returns an integer created from the data
Return a simple boolean based on the variable

Contains everything to do with retrieving and outputting posts in multiple forms. Is capable of retrieving posts stored in .json format (preferred when available) as well as plaintext (file syntax described below in constructor).
docblock.long-description: Contains functions to output the post data in html format for displaying to a page, and atom format for use in generating an atom feed.

docblock.description: Contains everything to do with retrieving and outputting posts in multiple forms. Is capable of retrieving posts stored in .json format (preferred when available) as well as plaintext (file syntax described below in constructor).
docblock.long-description: Contains functions to output the post data in html format for displaying to a page, and atom format for use in generating an atom feed.

docblock.description: Contains functions for testing and externally accessing data from blog posts.
This file defines a path constant to the root of the PHP engine. It is prepended to all PHP files. It must be configured prior to running the Gnat web engine.
Constructs json data

tag.name: author
tag.description: Nate Levesque <public@thenaterhood.com> Language: PHP Filename: core_json.php

Creates json data from an associative array using php's builtin json_encode function
Returns the json data
Class file for the dataMonger class

Provides a common interface for picking up variables from the user in a clean way, so that internal variables for pulling pages and otherwise can be managed more easily and sanitation settings are more easily applied site-wide.
Iterates through all the variables requested in $request and sets them to their defaults or from the URL/cookie.

tag.name: param
tag.description: (array) - a list of variables to retrieve

docblock.description: Provides a class for managing redirecting a page.
docblock.long-description: The class accepts a destination and origin and allows for a redirect to be applied at any time, providing an advantage over using only PHP's builtin redirect resources.

docblock.description: Provides a class for storing and applying a redirect to another area of a website.
Produces an instance of the class
Provides a simple text output to check if the class was initiated correctly
Applies the redirect to the page
Performs a 301 (permanent) redirect
Performs a 302 (temporary) redirect
Contains configuration settings for the site engine to use as a php class that can be directly accessed.

tag.name: author
tag.description: Nate Levesque <public@thenaterhood.com> Language: PHP Filename: core_config.php

docblock.description: Defines a class to hold variables for configuration options. All variables are accessible only internally to keep things fairly clean.
variables are documented where they are set lower in the code.

tag.name: var
tag.description: provides a clean way of storing an expanding mass of variables.

docblock.description: Sets the configuration options en-masse.
Returns the value of the requested config key

tag.name: return
tag.description: the value the key is associated with

docblock.description: Returns a valid feed with the requested format.

tag.name: param
tag.description: • the type of feed to return (atom/rss). Defaults to atom (superior) if the type given not recognized.

docblock.description: Returns a displayable representation of the feed with appropriate code added. Relies on the article atom_output() function to generate code for individidual feed items. Returns ATOM format.
Returns a displayable representation of the feed with appropriate code added for RSS format.

docblock.description: Provides an interface for unit testing the redirect class.
docblock.long-description: Does not actually redirect, just returns what the class was initialized with in order to verify it can be initialized correctly.

docblock.description: Provides a consistent interface for accessing posts or articles with multiple methods of displaying and managing the contained data.

Contains everything to do with retrieving and outputting posts in multiple forms. Is capable of retrieving posts stored in .json format (preferred when available) as well as plaintext (file syntax described below in constructor).

docblock.description: Reads and parses a post file and creates an instance of the class with the post data. Capable of managing posts in json and plaintext, but prefers json if a json file exists for the requested post.

Produces the coded output of the item that can be returned and displayed or saved in an rss feed
Produces the coded output of the item that can be displayed on an html page
Returns the article metadata - tags, title, link, date, and author as an associative array.
Returns a string containing the post title and tags, suitable for outputting in an atom feed (maybe) or an html list

Provides a self-sufficient file with the inventory class, which abstracts access to a data file containing an index of posts or articles in a directory.

Provides a database-like means of accessing an inventory of posts or articles in a directory for efficiently searching for things by certain criteria, as well as maintaining and updating the data. Stored in json format currently, but due to being abstracted out, could be modified to store the data in other formats.

tag.name: var
tag.description: • whether the inventory appears to be up to date

tag.name: var
tag.description: • the file where the inventory is stored (autogen)

tag.name: var
tag.description: • the parsed inventory data that the class accesses

tag.name: var
tag.description: • the uri that returns the requested pages

docblock.description: Constructs an instance of the class

tag.name: param
tag.description: • the directory of which the inventory is of

docblock.description: Creates a list of files in the working directory, sorts and reverses the list, and returns it. Intended for working with blog posts stored as text files with date-coded filenames
Checks the number of files in the current directory and compares it to how many are listed in the current inventory.
docblock.long-description: If the number doesn't match, it returns False.

docblock.description: Regenerates the blog inventory file
Writes the inventory data out to the file

tag.description: • the name of the field to access

docblock.description: Returns all the fields in the inventory
